events.message: The customer reported an auto accident involving their car and filed an initial claim for the damages witnessed after the collision.
The claim was categorized under Auto Accident due to the presence of keywords like vehicle and collision in the initial report.
An agent was assigned promptly to handle the auto accident claim and contact the customer for further details about the incident.
The customer was sent an acknowledgment email confirming receipt and opening of their auto accident claim.
The insurance company requested the police report and photos of the damaged vehicle to proceed with claim investigation.
The customer uploaded all requested documents including the police report and incident photos within the given deadline.
The investigation team began reviewing the submitted documents and vehicle condition to determine liability and claim scope.
The investigation concluded with findings confirming the collision was caused by a third party, validating the customer's claim.
A settlement offer covering all repair costs was proposed to the customer based on the investigation results and claim terms.
The customer confirmed acceptance of the settlement proposal and expressed satisfaction with the claim handling process.
The claim was approved officially after the customer accepted the settlement offer and all necessary documentation was completed.
The payment to cover the vehicle repairs was issued to the customerâ€™s designated bank account without any delays.
The claim was officially closed in the system after confirming all payments were settled and customer issues resolved.
All claim records and documents were archived securely for future reference and compliance with company policies.
